classes.description: A master of invention and craft, the Tinkerer uses a blend of magic and mechanical ingenuity to create devices that aid in both combat and problem-solving.
The Brute is a fierce warrior, known for raw strength and resilience. They excel in close combat, using their physical prowess to overpower foes.
The Minstrel is a charismatic performer, using music and magic to inspire allies and hinder enemies. Their abilities often enhance the capabilities of their companions.
The Acolyte is a devout follower of a deity or cause, wielding divine magic to heal and protect allies while also being capable of smiting foes.
The Shaman draws power from the natural world, using it to cast spells and summon creatures. They are protectors of nature and balance.
The Veteran is a seasoned combatant, skilled in a wide array of weapons and armor. They are versatile warriors, adaptable to any combat situation.

skills.name: Fighting Style
skills.description: You adopt a particular style of fighting as your specialty. Choose one of the following options. You can't take a Fighting Style option more than once, even if you later get to choose again.

skills.name: Second Wind
skills.description: You have a limited well of stamina. On your turn, you can use a bonus action to regain hit points equal to 1d10 + your fighter level. You must finish a short or long rest before you can use it again.

skills.name: Action Surge
skills.description: Starting at 2nd level, you can push yourself beyond your normal limits for a moment. On your turn, you can take one additional action on top of your regular action and a possible bonus action. Once used, finish a short or long rest to use it again.

skills.name: Martial Archetype
skills.description: At 3rd level, you choose an archetype that you strive to emulate in your combat styles and techniques.

skills.name: Ability Score Improvement
skills.description: You can increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or two ability scores by 1. You can’t increase an ability score above 20 using this feature.

skills.name: Martial Versatility
skills.description: Whenever you reach a level in this class that grants the Ability Score Improvement feature, you can also replace a fighting style you know with another style available.

skills.name: Extra Attack
skills.description: Beginning at 5th level, you can attack twice, instead of once, whenever you take the Attack action on your turn.

skills.name: Ability Score Improvement
skills.description: You can increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or two ability scores by 1.

skills.name: Martial Archetype Feature
skills.description: You gain a feature from your chosen Martial Archetype.

skills.name: Ability Score Improvement
skills.description: Increase ability scores by 2 or split +1/+1.

skills.name: Indomitable
skills.description: You can reroll a saving throw that you fail. You must use the new roll, and you can’t use this feature again until you finish a long rest.

skills.name: Martial Archetype Feature
skills.description: You gain another feature from your chosen Martial Archetype.

skills.name: Extra Attack (2)
skills.description: You can attack three times, instead of twice, whenever you take the Attack action on your turn.

skills.name: Indomitable (2 uses)
skills.description: You can use Indomitable twice between long rests.

skills.name: Martial Archetype Feature
skills.description: You gain another feature from your chosen Martial Archetype.

skills.name: Action Surge (2 uses)
skills.description: You can use Action Surge twice between rests.

skills.name: Indomitable (3 uses)
skills.description: You can use Indomitable three times between long rests.

skills.name: Martial Archetype Feature
skills.description: You gain another feature from your chosen Martial Archetype.

skills.name: Extra Attack (3)
skills.description: You can attack four times with the Attack action.

subclasses.name: Champion
subclasses.description: The Champion focuses on the development of raw physical power honed to deadly perfection.

features.name: Improved Critical
features.description: Your weapon attacks score a critical hit on a roll of 19 or 20.

features.name: Remarkable Athlete
features.description: You can add half your proficiency bonus (rounded up) to any Strength, Dexterity, or Constitution check you make that doesn’t already use your proficiency bonus.

features.name: Additional Fighting Style
features.description: You can choose a second option from the Fighting Style class feature.

features.name: Superior Critical
features.description: Your weapon attacks score a critical hit on a roll of 18–20.

features.name: Survivor
features.description: You regain hit points equal to 5 + your Constitution modifier at the start of your turn if you have no more than half your hit points left.

subclasses.name: Battle Master
subclasses.description: The Battle Master uses martial techniques and maneuvers to control the battlefield with calculated precision.

features.name: Combat Superiority
features.description: You learn maneuvers that are fueled by superiority dice (d8). You can use them to enhance attacks and defense.

features.name: Know Your Enemy
features.description: You can spend at least 1 minute observing or interacting with another creature outside combat to learn information about it.

features.name: Improved Combat Superiority
features.description: Your superiority dice turn into d10s. At level 18, they become d12s.

features.name: Relentless
features.description: When you roll initiative and have no superiority dice remaining, you regain one.

features.name: Improved Combat Superiority (d12)
features.description: Your superiority dice turn into d12s at this level, increasing the effectiveness of your maneuvers.

subclasses.name: Eldritch Knight
subclasses.description: The Eldritch Knight blends martial prowess with magic, learning spells to enhance combat.

features.name: Spellcasting
features.description: You gain the ability to cast spells, choosing from the wizard spell list with a focus on abjuration and evocation.

features.name: Weapon Bond
features.description: You perform a ritual that bonds a weapon to you. You can summon it instantly and cannot be disarmed of it.

features.name: War Magic
features.description: When you use your action to cast a cantrip, you can make one weapon attack as a bonus action.

features.name: Eldritch Strike
features.description: When you hit a creature with a weapon attack, it has disadvantage on the next saving throw it makes against a spell you cast before the end of your next turn.

features.name: Arcane Charge
features.description: When you use Action Surge, you can teleport up to 30 feet to an unoccupied space you can see.

features.name: Improved War Magic
features.description: When you use your action to cast a spell, you can make one weapon attack as a bonus action.

classes.description: The Disciple is a martial artist, harnessing their body's energy to perform extraordinary feats of agility and strength. They often follow a strict code or philosophy.
The Faithful is a holy warrior, sworn to uphold justice and righteousness. They combine martial prowess with divine magic to smite enemies and protect the innocent.
The Hunter is a skilled tracker and survivor, adept at navigating and thriving in the wilderness. They are deadly with ranged weapons and have a deep connection with nature.
The Scoundrel is a cunning and stealthy operative, excelling in deception and surprise attacks. They are adept at infiltrating and navigating through enemy lines unseen.
The Arcanist wields innate magical power, bending reality to their will. Their magic is intuitive and deeply personal, drawn from an inner wellspring of arcane energy.
The Cultist gains power through pacts with otherworldly entities. Their abilities are granted by these patrons, often at a cost that reflects their dark bargains.
The Runemage is a scholar of the arcane, using spells drawn from ancient texts and relentless study. They are masters of magical theory and can wield a vast array of spells.
